definition: to draw water/(fig.) to promote sb to a more senior position

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: The purposes of a man's heart are deep waters, but a man of understanding draws them out.
sentences.chinese: 人心懷藏謀略，好像水深，惟明哲人才能汲引出來。

sentences.english: Still they call forth my warm affection's tear.
sentences.chinese: 它們依舊汲引我深情的淚液。

sentences.english: This clbum; I'll promote a monitor; and you will take a election for it.
sentences.chinese: 這節課，我想汲引一名班長，專家可以選舉。

sentences.english: People from many places were drawn to the city by its growing economy.
sentences.chinese: 來自各地的人們被經濟突飛的城市所汲引。

definition: select the best people for promotion
to depend ultimately on (Tw)/absolutely reliant on
to curry favor/to advance one's career by toadying
to do business/to manage/to strive for/to use every possible means (toward a goal)
to secure a position/to take an official appointment
